Legal_Issue: Whether a visa officer must interview an applicant to assess 'Personal Suitability' under Factor 9 of the Immigration Regulations
Evidence_Assessment: Assessment of applicant's qualifications, financial resources, and personal suitability
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility under immigration regulations
Legal_Rule: Factor 9 requires visa officer to conduct an interview to assess personal suitability
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on jurisdictional interpretation
Procedural_Issue: Failure to grant mandatory interview under Factor 9
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness, failure to comply with regulatory requirements
Outcome_on_Merits: Not determined; decision quashed due to procedural error
Review_Standard: Judicial review for certiorari and mandamus
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation of procedural fairness by denying required interview
Key_Evidence_Considered: Immigration application, financial documents, qualifications, affidavit
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of interview and refusal without full assessment
Defendant_Response: Applicant would not meet requirements even with maximum points from interview
Outcome: Decision set aside, new assessment ordered
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of decision and order for reconsideration
Applicable_Process: Immigration application process with interview requirement under Factor 9
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Reconsideration of visa application with interview
Governing_Rule: Factor 9 requiring interview for personal suitability assessment
